title: Provides for certification of vote by local board of elections for all votes
summary: Requires county boards of elections to provide the state board of elections with votes cast for all nominations.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2248

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the election law, in relation to certification of the vote

PURPOSE:
Requires county boards of elections to provide the state board of
elections with votes cast for all nominations.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Amends §9-200, subdivision 3 to omit the last phrase, "in a district
extended beyond the political unit for which the board is acting."
This will allow the state board to receive all election results for
judicial district delegates and state committee members throughout
the state so that when the certification of delegates and alternates
is made, the state board will have a listing of the election results
for every delegate, alternate and committeeperson including those
wholly contained within a county.

The bill would require that county boards of elections provide a
certified copy of the votes cast for ALL nominations for party
positions INCLUDING those where the district is wholly
contained within the county.

JUSTIFICATION:
The state board of elections is required to furnish the chairs of
state parties with a list of duly elected members of state committees
as well as a certification of those elected to judicial nominating
conventions.
Presently, the information provided to the state board from county
boards of elections does not include the votes cast for those persons
elected at the primary election for these offices whose districts do
not cross county lines. If the state board is to certify the results
of all members of the state committee and judicial nominating
conventions, the tabulated statements of votes cast for all of these
offices, even those wholly contained within the county, should be
provided to the state board of elections.

FISCAL IMPACT:
Unknown.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
